entries.title: Social Spaces
entries.description: This class explores the presentation of self, the presentation of collectives, the presentation of news, and social dynamics in these online spaces--and how algorithmic intervention shapes them from the perspective of social signalling theory.

entries.title: Social Visualization and Social Computing
entries.description: This class explores visualizing social interaction in networked spaces.  We emphasize visualizing the network identity of the person over compilations of online data that characterize information visualization.

entries.title: Social Computing Seminar
entries.description: This seminar serves as a reading group dealing with topics germane to research in social computation.

entries.title: Multimedia Systems and Applications
entries.description: In this course, we will cover fundamental principles of human perception, multimedia interfaces, and multimedia systems.
